Detailed Description

This file contains functions which interface interactively with the user through the serial console to perform some utility operations.

Function Documentation

uint8_t UARTConfigGetc ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

This function reads a byte entered on the serial console.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of UART instance.
Returns
Returns the entered byte typecasted as an unsigned character.
uint32_t UARTConfigGetHexNum ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

This function receives hexadecimal numbers entered on the serial console of the host machine.

Parameters
None
Returns
The hexadecimal number entered on the serial console of the host machine.
Note
1> The points below explain the ways of entering hexadecimal numbers:
  • 0xABCDEF12 - Hexadecimal number preceded by a '0x'.
  • 0XABCDEF12 - Hexadecimal number preceded by a '0X'.
  • 0xabcdef12 - Lower-case alphanumeric numbers are allowed.
  • 0xaBcDeF12 - Intermixing of lower-case and upper-case alphanumeric numbers is allowed.
  • abcdef12 - A preceding '0x' or '0X' is not requried. The entered number shall be treated as a hexadecimal number.
  • 12345678 - Interpreted as 0x12345678 and not decimal 12345678.
  • xABCDEF12 - A preceding '0' is not required.
    2> This function does not take into consideration any character other than a hexadecimal character after reception.
    Example: Characters in the range G,H,I,...Z or g,h,...,z are not taken into consideration.
    3> The maximum value that can be returned by this function is 0xFFFFFFFF. The reception exits after eight characters have been received.
    4> To input a number lesser that eight characters (Ex: 0x1AB), press the 'Enter' key after entering the number.
int32_t UARTConfigGetNum ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

This function reads the numbers typed on the serial console.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of UART instance.
Returns
The value entered on the serial console.
Note
The numbers that this function can recieve should lie in the following range: [-2^(31)] to [2^(31) - 1] i.e. 0x80000000 to 0x7FFFFFFF
uint32_t UARTConfigGets ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
char *  pRxBuffer,
int32_t  numBytesToRead 
)

This function reads data from the receiver FIFO to a buffer in the receiver.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of UART instance.
pRxBufferPointer to a buffer in the receiver.
numBytesToReadThe number of bytes the receiver buffer can hold. However, if the user wishes not to specify this parameter, he has freedom to do so. In that case, the user has to pass a negative value for this parameter.
Returns
Number of bytes read from the receiver FIFO.
Note
The two exit points for this function are: 1> To enter an ESC character or a carraige return character('Enter' key on the Keyboard).
2> Specify a limit to the number of bytes to be read.
Some example function calls of this function are:

UARTGets(rxBuffer, -2): This reads characters from the receiver FIFO of UART until the occurence of a carriage return ('Enter' key on the keyboard pressed) or an ESC character.

UARTGets(rxBuffer, 12): This reads characters until 12 characters have been read or until an occurence of a carriage return or an ESC character, whichever occurs first.

void UARTConfigPutNum ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
int32_t  value 
)

This function prints the specified numbers(positive or negative) on the serial console.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of UART instance.
valueThe number to be printed on the serial console.
Returns
None.
Note
The numbers that this function can print should lie in the following range: [-2^(31)] to [2^(31) - 1] i.e. 0x80000000 to 0x7FFFFFFF
uint32_t UARTConfigPuts ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
char *  pTxBuffer,
int32_t  numBytesToWrite 
)

This function writes data from a specified buffer onto the transmitter FIFO of UART.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of UART instance.
pTxBufferPointer to a buffer in the transmitter.
numBytesToWriteNumber of bytes to be transmitted to the transmitter FIFO. The user has the freedom to not specify any valid value for this if he wants to print until the occurence of a NULL character. In this case, he has to pass a negative value as this parameter.
Returns
Number of bytes written to the transmitter FIFO.
Note
1> Whenever a null character(\0) is encountered in the data to be transmitted, the transmission is stopped.
2> Whenever the transmitter data has a new line character(
), it is interpreted as a new line(
) + carraige return() characters. This is because the serial console interprets a new line character as it is and does not introduce a carraige return.
Some example function calls of this function are:
UARTPuts(txArray, -2): This shall print the contents of txArray[] until the occurence of a NULL character.
UARTPuts("Hello World", 8): This shall print the first 8 characters of the string shown.
UARTPuts("Hello World", 20): This shall print the string shown until the occurence of the NULL character. Here, the NULL character is encountered earlier than the length of 20 bytes.
